Object of Education. 
     1182. The foundation of all right education is a knowledge of God. . . . The first and most important lesson to be impressed upon young minds is the duty of regulating the life by the principles of the word of God. . . . The true object of education is to fit us for this service by developing and bringing into active exercise every faculty that we possess.--S. of T., 1884, No. 12.
